actor.name: Clark Gable
actor.description: Born in 1901, Clark Gable was hailed as the "King of Hollywood." His portrayal of Rhett Butler in "Gone with the Wind" remains one of the most iconic performances in film history.

actor.name: Bette Davis
actor.description: Born in 1908, Bette Davis was celebrated for her powerful and versatile acting. She appeared in classics like "All About Eve" and "What Ever Happened to Baby Jane?" and earned two Academy Awards during her illustrious career.

actor.name: Audrey Hepburn
actor.description: Born in 1929, Audrey Hepburn embodied elegance and grace. Her roles in "Breakfast at Tiffany's" and "Roman Holiday" made her an adored figure in both cinema and fashion.

actor.name: Humphrey Bogart
actor.description: Born in 1899, Humphrey Bogart became an enduring Hollywood legend known for his tough-guy roles. He starred in iconic films like "Casablanca" and "The Maltese Falcon," and his stoic demeanor and distinctive style left an indelible mark on the film industry.

actor.name: Cary Grant
actor.description: Cary Grant, born in 1904, epitomized style and elegance. His roles in "North by Northwest" and "To Catch a Thief" solidified his status as one of Hollywood's most recognizable and beloved actors.

actor.name: Katharine Hepburn
actor.description: Born in 1907, Katharine Hepburn was an extraordinarily talented actress who won four Academy Awards. Her role in "The Philadelphia Story" is considered one of her finest.

actor.name: Marilyn Monroe
actor.description: Born in 1926, Marilyn Monroe was the quintessential symbol of femininity and sensuality in Hollywood. Her performances in "Some Like It Hot" and "The Seven Year Itch" catapulted her to stardom, and her enigmatic presence continues to captivate audiences worldwide.

actor.name: James Stewart
actor.description: James Stewart, born in 1908, was known for his endearing characters and heartfelt performances. His roles in "It's a Wonderful Life" and "Mr. Smith Goes to Washington" continue to resonate with audiences.

actor.name: John Wayne
actor.description: John Wayne, born in 1907, became an iconic figure in the Western genre. His roles in films like "True Grit" and "Stagecoach" cemented his status as one of Hollywood's most recognizable actors.

actor.name: Ingrid Bergman
actor.description: Born in 1915, Ingrid Bergman was renowned for her talent and beauty. Her performances in "Casablanca" and "Notorious" solidified her place as one of the greatest actresses in cinematic history.

actor.name: Spencer Tracy
actor.description: Born in 1900, Spencer Tracy was known for his versatility and naturalistic acting style. He starred in numerous classics, including "Guess Who's Coming to Dinner" and "It's a Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad World."

actor.name: Joan Crawford
actor.description: Born in 1904, Joan Crawford was a prominent actress known for her glamour and intensity. She won an Academy Award for her role in "Mildred Pierce" and became one of the leading actresses of her time.

actor.name: Henry Fonda
actor.description: Born in 1905, Henry Fonda was celebrated for his powerful performances and authenticity. He appeared in iconic films such as "12 Angry Men" and "The Grapes of Wrath," leaving a lasting legacy in Hollywood.
